short_description: colne valley museum is a museum based in huddersfield, united kingdom.
long_description: four 19th century weavers' cottages form a 'living history' museum providing education for children and the wider public of life in the domestic wool textile industry in the valleys of west yorkshire. colne valley museum is held in trust for the education of people, especially children, in the history and way of life in the colne valley between 1800 and 1920, through the preservation of industrial, professional, educational and domestic items formerly used by the inhabitants of the colne valley. it promotes a local interest in the arts and demonstrates, thus preserving, the traditional skills of the period with and for future generations. the museum also seeks to conserve and develop the buildings which it owns in order to fulfill the previously stated purpose. colne valley museum's governing body is its trustees. we open with a volunteers' weekend and. these will include a food related activity, paper crafts and textile activities.

generated_description: colne valley museum is a museum located in huddersfield, england. it is housed in a grade ii listed building that consists of four cottages built in the 1840s by the pearsons, a family of independent cloth manufacturers. the museum operates as a 'living history' site, providing educational experiences about life in the domestic wool textile industry in the valleys of west yorkshire during the 19th century. the museum features live demonstrations, exhibitions, and school and group visits, and aims to preserve and promote traditional skills and local history. the museum is managed by a trustees' governing body and a management committee, with day-to-day operations overseen by the latter.
